paragraphs.title: Reading data from a file
paragraphs.text:
%r
data1 <- read.df("s3://dev.canopydata.com/vipulm/data/pypariris.parquet", "parquet")
data2 <- read.df("s3://dev.canopydata.com/vipulm/data/train.csv", "csv")
data3 <- read.df("s3://dev.canopydata.com/vipulm/data/test1.json","json")
head(data1)
head(data2)
head(data3)

paragraphs.title: Reading from a table to a spark dataframe using sql
paragraphs.text:
%r
result <- sql("from src select key,value")
result
head(result)

paragraphs.title: Display specific columns of a spark data frame

result.msg:
SparkDataFrame[eruptions:double, waiting:double]
  eruptions waiting
1     3.600      79
2     1.800      54
3     3.333      74
4     2.283      62
5     4.533      85
6     2.883      55
  eruptions waiting
1     3.600      79
2     1.800      54
3     3.333      74
4     2.283      62
5     4.533      85
6     2.883      55

paragraphs.title: Simple aggregations : groupBy, arrange
paragraphs.text:
%r

waitcount <- summarize(groupBy(df,df$waiting),count = n(df$waiting),sum(df$waiting))
head(waitcount)
head(arrange(waitcount,asc(waitcount$count)))
waitsec <-select(df,df$waiting*60)
head(waitsec)

paragraphs.title: agg function: apply aggregation functions to grouped data
paragraphs.text:
%r

irisdf <- as.DataFrame(iris)
d1 <- filter(irisdf,irisdf$Sepal_Length>=5.0)
d2 <- agg(group_by(d1,d1$Species),count = n(d1$Species), sum(d1$Sepal_Length)) 

head(d2)

result.msg:
Sepal_Length Sepal_Width Petal_Length Petal_Width Species
1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa
2          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa
3          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa
4          5.0         3.4          1.5         0.2  setosa
5          5.4         3.7          1.5         0.2  setosa
6          5.8         4.0          1.2         0.2  setosa

paragraphs.title: sql in sparkR
paragraphs.text:
%r

sql("CREATE TABLE ta1 (ID INT, name varchar)")
sql("INSERT INTO ta1 VALUES (1,'a'),(2,'b'),(3,'c')")

sql("CREATE TABLE ta2 (ID INT, grade double)")
sql("INSERT INTO ta2 VALUES (1,7.8),(2,8.6),(3,9.5)")

df1 <- sql("select * from ta1")
df2 <- sql("select * from ta2")
head(df1)
head(df2)

sql("drop table ta1")
sql("drop table ta2")

#head(join(df1,df2))
join(df1,df2,df1$ID==df2$ID)

result.msg:
SparkDataFrame[]
SparkDataFrame[]
SparkDataFrame[]
SparkDataFrame[]
  id name
1  1    a
2  2    b
3  3    c
  id grade
1  1   7.8
2  2   8.6
3  3   9.5
SparkDataFrame[]
SparkDataFrame[]
SparkDataFrame[id:int, name:string, id:int, grade:double]

paragraphs.title: dapply
paragraphs.text:
%r

df <- createDataFrame(faithful)

schema <- structType(structField("eruptions", "double"), structField("waiting", "double"),
                     structField("waiting_secs", "double"))
                     
df1 <- dapply(df, function(x) { x <- cbind(x, x$waiting * 60) }, schema)

head(collect(df1))

paragraphs.title: %>% operator
paragraphs.text:
%r
library(magrittr)
df <- createDataFrame(iris)
df %>%
  select("Sepal_Length", "Species") %>%
  filter(df$Sepal_Length >= 5.5) %>%
  group_by(df$Species) %>%
  summarize(count = n(df$Sepal_Length), mean = mean(df$Sepal_Length)) %>%
  collect
  
head(df)

result.msg:
Species count     mean


1  virginica    49 6.622449
2 versicolor    44 6.050000
3     setosa     5 5.640000
  Sepal_Length Sepal_Width Petal_Length Petal_Width Species
1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa
2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa
3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa
4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa
5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa
6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa

paragraphs.title: %>% operator
paragraphs.text:
%r

library(magrittr)

irisdf <- as.DataFrame(iris)
irisdf
select(irisdf,"Sepal_Length","Species") %>% filter(irisdf$Sepal_Length>=5.0) %>% group_by(irisdf$Species) %>% summarize(count = n(irisdf$Species)) %>% collect

result.msg:
SparkDataFrame[Sepal_Length:double, Sepal_Width:double, Petal_Length:double, Petal_Width:double, Species:string]
     Species count
1  virginica    49
2 versicolor    49
3     setosa    30

paragraphs.title: Subsetting spark dataframe
paragraphs.text:
%r

df <- createDataFrame(iris)
head(df)

#filter rows
head(df[df$Species == "virginica"])
head(df[df$Sepal_Length>5.0])

#select column
head(df[,"Sepal_Length"])

#df can be subsetted on both rows and columns
head(df[df$Species == "virginica" & (df$Sepal_Length>7.0 | df$Sepal_Length<5.0 ), c(1,5)])
head(df[df$Species %in% c("setosa","virginica"),1:2])
head(subset(df,df$Species %in% c("setosa","virginica"),1:2))

paragraphs.title: Read hive table to spark df and write spark df to hive table
paragraphs.text:
%r

result <- sql("from default_qubole_airline_origin_destination select *")
result
saveAsTable(result,"tableforresult")
reading <- sql("select * from tableforresult")
head(reading)
sql("drop table tableforresult")

paragraphs.title: Read and write a spark df to a hive table
paragraphs.text:
%r
rm(list=ls())
result <- createDataFrame(iris)
result
saveAsTable(result,"tableforiris")
reading <- sql("from tableforiris select * ")
head(reading)
sql("drop table tableforiris")

result.msg:
SparkDataFrame[Sepal_Length:double, Sepal_Width:double, Petal_Length:double, Petal_Width:double, Species:string]

SparkDataFrame[]

paragraphs.title: Write a spark df to a parquet file, read parquet file to a spark df
paragraphs.text:
%r

pariris <- createDataFrame(iris)
write.parquet(pariris,"pariris1.parquet")
parquetFile <- read.parquet("pariris1.parquet")
parquetFile

paragraphs.title: Write spark df to parquet using saveDF()
Write spark df to parquet using saveAsParquetFile(), read using parquetFile()
paragraphs.text:
%r
sqlContext <- sparkRSQL.init(sc)
pariris <- createDataFrame(iris)
saveAsParquetFile(pariris, "pariri.parquet")
parquetFile <- parquetFile(sqlContext, "pariri.parquet")
